title: How (Not) To Bale Hay : Busted Belts

tasks.task: Driving a tractor and operating a baler machine.
subtasks: Maneuvering a 2000-pound hay bale.
Adjusting the tractor's speed and operating speedometers.
Fine-tuning the baler machine to avoid breakdowns.
Securing hay bales and dealing with potential leaks.
Managing farm animals (dogs/Coug) to prevent interference during work.
Addressing machinery issues (belt replacement).

tasks.task: Operating a baler with an assistant.
subtasks: Working in tandem with the assistant to adjust the baler settings.
Communicating with the assistant about machine adjustments and progress.
Ensuring the quality and safety of the bales.
Attempting to fix the broken belt on the baler.
Replacing a belt on the baler machine.
Considering alternative balers when primary fails.
Tracking time spent on tasks due to equipment issues.
Considering the impact of time constraints on the day's work.
Noting the number of bales produced.
Logging equipment malfunctions and necessary repairs.
